4154597920.title: Analista Funcional Banca
4154597920.description:
About the job
🚀 Únete a Minsait como Analista Funcional- Banca🚀

En Minsait, buscamos talento para impulsar la transformación digital. ¡Súmate a nuestro equipo y sé parte del cambio!

🎯 Sobre el equipo y TU impacto
Sé parte de un equipo multidisciplinario que está dando forma al futuro de la banca, aquí no solo gestionamos proyectos, los reinventamos!
Trabajamos en un entorno dinámico y desafiante, donde las soluciones innovadoras son clave para anticiparnos a las necesidades de nuestros clientes.

🌟 Motivos para ser un MINSAITER:

En Minsait, trabajamos para que nuestros profesionales encuentren el equilibrio perfecto entre su vida personal y profesional.
Por eso, te ofrecemos:

🤝 Entorno humano y retador
Equipo excepcional y diverso, con profesionales especializados y siempre actualizados.
Entorno que fomenta la innovación, el respeto y el crecimiento conjunto.
Proyectos únicos y retadores con tecnologías punteras, donde tu talento será protagonista.

⏳ Conciliación y Flexibilidad
Modelos de trabajo adaptados: 100% remoto o híbrido, dependiendo del puesto.
Flexibilidad horaria.
32 días laborables de descanso anuales.
Jornada intensiva en verano y todos los viernes.

📈 Desarrollo Profesional
Planes de carrera personalizados que te permitirán alcanzar todo tu potencial.
Formación continua con acceso gratuito a Udemy.

💼 Condiciones Competitivas
Contrato indefinido y retribución acorde a tu experiencia y perfil.
Seguro de vida.
Acceso a planes de retribución flexible: tarjeta restaurante, guardería, transporte y seguro médico privado.

💆‍♂️ Bienestar Integral
Programa de bienestar: acceso a una red de gimnasios, revisiones médicas, fisioterapia en oficina, talleres de salud y servicios de telemedicina en línea.

🛠 Lo que harás con nosotros
Diseños Funcionales, sobre proyectos de banca en java y se valoraría también en la parte host (PL/I).
Tendrás reuniones con cliente en Barcelona

🔍 Lo que buscamos en ti
Experiencia de 3 a 5 años como Analista Funcional en entorno Bancario con las tecnologías que ya hemos descrito.
Analista funcional microservicios y mainframe.
Java Microservicios, Oracle 
Conocimientos Funcionales: Servicios Financieros, Gestion de Activos y Pasivos

Minsait, technology for a more human future!
Nuestro compromiso es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

4173565752.title: Analista Jr Finanzas
4173565752.description:
About the job
Join Ibancar as a Junior Corporate Finance & FP&A Analyst – Accelerated Program!
Who are we?
At Ibancar World, we are an international leader in car-backed loans. Our unique approach of not repossessing the vehicle, not changing its ownership, and not charging rental fees has allowed us to improve the lives of thousands of clients. We’re growing, and we want you to be part of this mission!
Do you want to accelerate your career in corporate finance and learn directly from top management? We are looking for a Junior Analyst with strong analytical and logical skills, eager to dive into an intensive development program working closely with the CFO and the Finance Manager.
This is not a traditional operational role. From day one, you will be involved in high-impact strategic projects, with structured rotations through key areas: FP&A, accounting, treasury, and financial analysis.
 What are we looking for?
A dynamic, proactive, committed, responsible individual who is eager to learn every day.
 Your responsibilities will include:
´
Working directly with the CFO and Finance Manager on strategic decision-making.
Financial analysis and modeling: Evaluating proposals, profitability analysis, and cost optimization.
FP&A and financial planning: Creating and tracking budgets, forecasts, and variance analysis.
Accounting and treasury: Managing cash flow, reconciliations, and financial reporting.
Reporting and dashboards: Automating and structuring financial reports for decision-making.
Interaction with internal teams and stakeholders: Collaborating with business areas to optimize financial processes and strategies.
Participation in strategic projects: Opportunity to be involved in key initiatives for company growth.
 What we need from you:
A minimum of 1-2 years of experience in Finance (required).
Advanced Excel skills (financial models and report automation).
Advanced English and Spanish (essential, as you will interact with international stakeholders).
Strong analytical and logical ability for modeling scenarios and evaluating data.
Problem-solving skills.
 Work schedule:
Full-time, on-site position (40 hours per week).
Hours: 9:00 to 17:00.
 What we offer:
An inclusive, diverse, and discrimination-free work environment.
Opportunities for professional development and job stability.
Excellent work culture.
Training programs.
At Ibancar, we value our people and ensure equal treatment and opportunities for all.
 Are you ready to accelerate your career with us?
Apply now and join a company that makes a difference!
__________________________________________________________________________________
Únete a Ibancar como ¡Analista Junior de Finanzas Corporativas & FP&A – Programa Acelerado!
¿Quiénes somos?
En Ibancar World, somos un referente internacional en préstamos con coche como aval. Nuestra propuesta única de no retirar el vehículo, no cambiar su titularidad y no cobrar alquiler por su uso nos ha permitido mejorar la vida de miles de clientes. ¡Estamos creciendo y queremos que seas parte de esta misión!
¿Quieres acelerar tu carrera en finanzas corporativas y aprender directamente de la alta dirección? Buscamos un Analista Junior con gran capacidad analítica y lógica, que quiera sumergirse en un programa de desarrollo intensivo trabajando codo a codo con el CFO y el Manager de Finanzas.
Esta no es una posición operativa tradicional. Desde el primer día, estarás involucrado en proyectos estratégicos de alto impacto, con una rotación estructurada por distintas áreas clave: FP&A, contabilidad, tesorería y análisis financiero.
 ¿Qué buscamos?
Una persona con experiencia dinámica, proactiva, comprometida, responsable y con ganas de aprender día a día.
 Tus responsabilidades serán:
Trabajar directamente con el CFO y el Manager de Finanzas en la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Análisis financiero y modelización: Evaluación de propuestas, análisis de rentabilidad y optimización de costos.
FP&A y planeación financiera: Creación y seguimiento de presupuestos, forecast y análisis de variaciones.
Contabilidad y tesorería: Gestión del flujo de caja, conciliaciones y reportes financieros.
Reporting y dashboards: Automatización y estructuración de reportes financieros para toma de decisiones.
Interacción con equipos internos y stakeholders: Trabajo conjunto con áreas de negocio para optimizar procesos y estrategias financieras.
Participación en proyectos estratégicos: Oportunidad de involucrarte en iniciativas clave para el crecimiento de la empresa.
 Lo que necesitamos de ti:
Experiencia mínima de 1-2 años en Finanzas (excluyente).
Excel avanzado (modelos financieros y automatización de reportes)
Inglés y español avanzado (indispensable, interacción con stakeholders internacionales)
Gran capacidad analítica y lógica para modelizar escenarios y evaluar datos.
Habilidad para resolver problemas.
 Horario y jornada laboral:
Jornada completa presencial de 40 horas.
Horario: 9:00 a 17:00 horas.
 Lo que te ofrecemos:
Un entorno laboral inclusivo, diverso y libre de discriminación.
Oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y estabilidad laboral.
Excelente clima laboral.
Planes de formación.
En Ibancar, valoramos a nuestra gente y garantizamos igualdad de trato y oportunidades para todos.
 ¿Estás listo/a para acelerar tu carrera con nosotros?
¡Postula ahora y únete a una empresa que hace la diferencia!

4172314774.title: Junior Regulatory Reporting Analyst
4172314774.description:
About the job
Ebury is a leading global fintech company that empowers businesses to trade and grow internationally. It offers a comprehensive suite of products, including international payments and collections, FX risk management, trade finance, and API integrations. Founded in 2009 by Juan Lobato and Salvador García, Ebury is one of the fastest-growing global fintechs, with over 1,700 employees and 38 offices in more than 25 countries.

Junior Regulatory Reporting Analyst

Location: Ebury Leon Office - 4 days a week, 1 day working from home 

About The Role

The Finance team is a strong and growing part of the business. We’re looking for an individual who can support and challenge us in our journey to take finance to the next level.

This is a position that will require autonomy and attention to detail.

Responsibilities

Develop expertise on the business model and be able to support the local management with decisions related to finance
Support day-to-day tasks relating to Financial Regulatory Reporting projects from a Global perspective.
Assist in the creation and implementation of governance and oversight frameworks
Support all regulatory submissions, audits and reviews
Support for corporate projects impacting the current and future financial regulatory reporting framework to ensure project milestones are achieved.
Preparation and presentation of the capital results for allocated subsidiaries, including analysis and commentary of fluctuations period of period and analysis of ad-hoc unexpected movements.
Develop relationships across the business, including product, treasury, legal, wider finance Group and technology/data to deliver business insights
Review and prepare capital requirements estimate for different local subsidiaries of the Group and participate in the expansion of new countries and subsidiaries.
Assist preparing Risk Committee presentations regarding finance and capital
Other ad hoc analysis and local and group reporting requirements

Required Experience

Finance/Regulatory professional with 0-2 years of relevant experience; finance or legal background are a plus
IFRS and/or Regulatory expertise is a plus
Exceptional communication skills in English required
Ability to prioritise and manage multiple deadlines, work to tight schedules and provide a fast and efficient turnaround of tasks and problem resolutions
Be an analytical thinker who can focus on detail with a pragmatic outlook, able to lead debate and drive change whilst bearing in mind strategic requirements
High adaptability - ability to cope with product, system and role and responsibility change in a rapidly growing company
Excel capabilities
Someone looking to work on a global environment with a fast paced growing company.

About Us

Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.

Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1700 staff with a presence in more than 25 countries worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Bucharest to Toronto, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.

Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a £350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.

None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.

We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.

Please submit your application on the careers website directly, uploading your CV / resume in English.

4157536585.title: Analyst Reporting & Consolidation
4157536585.description:
About the job
At Sibelco, we advance life through materials.
For over 150 years, we’ve been a trusted leader in sourcing, transforming, and distributing specialty industrial minerals. Our work powers progress across industries as diverse as glass, ceramics, construction, coatings, polymers, and water purification. Beyond our materials, we’re proud of our commitment to sustainability, innovation, and empowering people from all walks of life to thrive and make a meaningful impact.

Are We the Perfect Match?
At Sibelco, we believe building a successful career is a two-way journey. We’re looking for individuals who share our values and vision, just as much as you’re seeking a company that aligns with your aspirations. Together, we can shape the future.

As part of our Global Controlling team, we are currently recruiting a Controlling Analyst, reporting to the Controlling Director and based in Bilbao, Spain. This role will interact with colleagues across all Sibelco locations and functions and contribute to the continuous improvement of financial reporting and controlling processes on a global scale.

Your Impact in This Role:
As a Controlling Analyst, you will play a key role in financial performance monitoring, reporting, and business analysis. You will ensure data accuracy, reporting consistency, and process optimization, leveraging Power BI and other financial tools to provide valuable insights to stakeholders across the business.

Key responsibilities include:
Collaborate with Local Finance teams and Global Functions to enhance financial reporting and data flow.
Gain an in-depth understanding of market trends, operational challenges, and business needs.
Prepare standard and ad hoc reports, including variance analysis with accurate and insightful commentary.
Perform scenario analysis and financial modeling to support business decisions.
Monitor key financial and operational performance indicators such as sales, profitability, working capital, and production costs.
Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards and standardized management reporting packs.
Assist in the annual budget and forecasting process, ensuring clear guidance and smooth execution.
Conduct analytical reviews of budgets and forecasts, challenging assumptions and identifying areas for improvement.

What You Bring to the Table:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or a related field.
Between 3 - 5 years of experience in a controlling or financial analysis role, preferably in a large multinational organization.
Strong knowledge of finance, accounting, budgeting, and cost control principles (GAAP & IFRS).
Experience in financial modeling, KPI analysis, and variance reporting.
Fluent English (verbal and written) – essential for communication with global teams.
Additional European languages are an asset.

Why Join Us?
Sibelco is more than a workplace—it’s a community that encourages growth, innovation, and collaboration. Here’s what you can look forward to when you join our team:
Meet Our People: Careers
Learn About Our Recruitment Process: Learn More
Discover Our Sustainability Goals: Sibelco priorities

We also welcome applications from all backgrounds and are committed to providing reasonable adjustments to support you through the selection process.

How To Apply
Follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter/X and Facebook to learn more about life at Sibelco. Submit your application in the Apply option.

Please note: We do not require agency services as we have a dedicated Global Talent Acquisition Team.
At Sibelco, we advance life through materials.
For over 150 years, we’ve been a trusted leader in sourcing, transforming, and distributing specialty industrial minerals. Our work powers progress across industries as diverse as glass, ceramics, construction, coatings, polymers, and water purification. Beyond our materials, we’re proud of our commitment to sustainability, innovation, and empowering people from all walks of life to thrive and make a meaningful impact.
Are We the Perfect Match?
At Sibelco, we believe building a successful career is a two-way journey. We’re looking for individuals who share our values and vision, just as much as you’re seeking a company that aligns with your aspirations. Together, we can shape the future.
As part of our Global Controlling team, we are currently recruiting a Controlling Analyst, reporting to the Controlling Director and based in Bilbao, Spain. This role will interact with colleagues across all Sibelco locations and functions and contribute to the continuous improvement of financial reporting and controlling processes on a global scale.

4136737942.title: Pricing Analyst
4136737942.description:
About the job
Analista de Pricing Grupo Fire

Sobre Grupo Fire:
Grupo Fire es un líder destacado en la industria de protección contra incendios en España, contando con más de 300 profesionales, una base de clientes que supera los 50,000, y operaciones en seis regiones. Conocidos por nuestro compromiso con la seguridad y la calidad, estamos en constante expansión y evolución para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros clientes y del mercado.

Estamos creciendo y en 2025 seremos la principal compañía de protección contra incendios en España.

Descripción del Puesto:
Buscamos un Analista de Pricing Estratégico que se especialice en la utilización de grandes bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones de precios y oportunidades de optimización. Este rol es clave para maximizar la rentabilidad y retención de clientes mediante ajustes estratégicos en la estructura de precios.

Responsabilidades Clave:
Analizar extensas bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones y tendencias en precios por tipo de cliente, servicio, área geográfica y tamaño de cliente.
Desarrollar modelos predictivos para determinar oportunidades de incremento de precios y evaluar el impacto potencial en la retención y rentabilidad.
Trabajar en conjunto con los equipos de operaciones y comerciales para implementar aumentos de precios y asegurar su aceptación en el mercado.
Monitorizar y evaluar el impacto de los ajustes de precios en la retención de clientes y la rentabilidad global de la empresa.
Realizar seguimiento continuo y análisis de la correlación entre incrementos de precios y cambios en la dinámica del mercado y comportamiento del cliente.

Calificaciones:
Título universitario en Economía, Finanzas, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Industrial o campo relacionado.
Al menos 3-5 años de experiencia en análisis de datos o roles analíticos financieros, con un fuerte enfoque en análisis de bases de datos grandes.
Experiencia específica en roles de pricing, incluyendo el desarrollo de estrategias de precios y evaluación de su efectividad.
Experiencia en modelado de datos, análisis predictivo y herramientas analíticas avanzadas.
Competencia comprobada para trabajar con datos complejos y realizar análisis cuantitativos detallados.
Excelentes habilidades comunicativas, con fluidez en español e inglés.

Lo Que Ofrecemos:
Salario competitivo con compensación variable basada en el rendimiento.
Oportunidades de crecimiento acelerado en una empresa que está expandiendo su tamaño anualmente.
Un ambiente colaborativo con un equipo de alto calibre.
Formación continua y oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.

Proceso de Aplicación:
Los candidatos interesados deben enviar su currículum y una carta de presentación explicando sus calificaciones e interés en el puesto a hello@ibventur.es

Ubicación: Barcelona o Madrid, España
Tipo de Contrato: Tiempo completo, Indefinido
Fecha de Inicio: Inmediata

4150372202.title: Senior Finance Analyst
4150372202.description:
About the job
Multiverse is a well-funded and fast-growing deep-tech company founded in 2019. We are the biggest Quantum Software company in the EU. We are also one of the 100 most promising companies in AI in the world (according to CB Insights, 2023) with 150+ employees and growing, fully multicultural and international.

We provide hyper-efficient software to companies seeking to gain an edge with quantum computing and artificial intelligence. Our main products, Singularity and CompactifAI, address critical needs across various industries. Singularity remains a trusted solution for blue-chip companies in finance, energy, manufacturing, cybersecurity, and more. CompactifAI, on the other hand, is a groundbreaking compression tool for foundational models based on Tensor Networks. With CompactifAi, one can compress AI systems, such as large language models, to make them more efficient and portable.

You will be working alongside world leading experts to build solutions that tackle real life issues. We look for passionate people that want to grow in an ethics driven environment, promoting sustainability and diversity. We aim to continue building our truly inclusive culture - come and join us.

In this position you will


Collaborate in the definition and implementation of efficient processes, proper accounting methods, controls and policies and industry best practices
Identify and execute opportunities to improve, automate and standardize processes
Provide financial and business analysis often with ambiguous information
Project Finance, budgeting and profitability
Monitor cost center expenses vs forecast
Build reports to transform financial data into business insights
Establish controls to guarantee data accuracy
Guide and mentor more junior team members
Coordinate financial operations & treasury
Control and follow up on posting processes of supplier invoices, taxes, payroll expenses and accruals.
Annual Accounts preparation, control and filling with other official books.
Tax review and fulfillment with tax advisor relationship
Intercompany reconciliations
Support in external audit processes


Required Qualifications


5-6 years of experience.
Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field.
Proven experience working in a big four or similar.
Proven experience in accounting & tax.
Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail.
Expert MS Office skills and ability to manipulate large data sets.
Fluent in English and Spanish.
Experience in Financial Modeling, P&L Management and analysis
Comfortable working in ambiguous and fast paced environment
Self-starter and pro active attitude


Perks & Benefits


Indefinite contract.
Equal pay guaranteed.
Variable performance bonus.
Signing bonus.
We offer work visa sponsorship (If applicable). 
Relocation package (If applicable).
Opportunity to be part of the phantom shares programme.
Private health insurance.
Flexible remuneration: hospitality and public transportation. 
Eligibility for educational budget according to internal policy.
Hybrid opportunity.
Flexible working hours.
Language classes and discounted lunch options
Working in a high paced environment, working on cutting edge technologies.
Career plan. Opportunity to learn and teach.
Progressive Company. Happy people culture.


As an equal opportunity employer, Multiverse Computing is committed to building an inclusive workplace. The company welcomes people from all different backgrounds, including age, citizenship, ethnic and racial origins, gender identities, individuals with disabilities, marital status, religions and ideologies, and sexual orientations to apply.

Come and join our multicultural team!

5 locations

+27 languages

4106721538.title: Senior Pricing Analyst
4106721538.description:
About the job
About Kiwi.com 

Kiwi.com is a leading global travel-tech company headquartered in the Czech Republic. Our innovative algorithm enables users to find better route options and prices other search engines can’t see, daily performing billions of price checks across 95% of global flight content. Are you bold, bright and curious? Join a global business that’s still got a start-up heart.

About Our Pricing Analytics Team 

Our Kiwi.com Pricing Analytics team is responsible for analyzing and optimizing our pricing strategies so that travelers can confidently find the best value for their chosen journeys. We apply cutting-edge data analysis techniques, experiment with market-driven hypotheses, and employ advanced modeling to balance user preferences, business objectives, and market conditions. For us, this work is inherently fascinating: it blends elements of economics, behavioral science, and technology, allowing us to refine our approaches as the industry evolves. Ultimately, our insights and optimizations not only ensure a better travel-shopping experience for our customers, but also strengthens Kiwi.com ’s competitive edge and long-term profitability.

What You Will Do 

You will develop and execute pricing strategies to maximize profit and sales growth.
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather data, identify pricing opportunities, and implement impactful pricing tactics.
You will lead corrective actions for missed pricing opportunities, ensuring sustainable, long-term solutions are in place.
By utilizing advanced pricing tools and technologies, you will drive innovation, automation, and optimization in pricing processes.
You will analyze and present business cases to senior leadership, including scenario simulations and ROI calculations for potential commercial agreements.
In collaboration with your team members, you will streamline and automate data-driven processes.

What You Will Need 

Your previous significant experience as an Analyst with advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills.
You bring previous experience in pricing and e-commerce businesses, with a focus on driving profit.
You have experience working with Data Visualization Tools (we use Looker).
Your strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and quality in data analysis.
You are intellectually curious, analytically rigorous, and possess a strong business acumen.
You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment with quick changes and where your work can have a significant business impact.
You are a great communicator with excellent spoken and written English, including your proven ability to communicate complex results to less data-savvy users.

We offer you 

We offer a hybrid and flexible work environment. A lovely, modern office in the center of Barcelona (Passeig de Gracia) with great views and amenities.
We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days, sick days, private medical insurance, Employee Assistance Program, Wellhub membership, the annual subscription for El Bicing. 
Annual financial bonus based on company and individual performance.
Flight vouchers to celebrate your Kiwi anniversaries.
Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
Dogs are welcome in our offices.

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it’s finished, we’re going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/.

4081447481.title: Pricing Analyst
4081447481.location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
4081447481.description:
About the job
Fluidra es una empresa líder a nivel global en el sector de la piscina y el wellness 💦

¿Quieres conocernos?

Somos un grupo multinacional con una dilatada experiencia en el desarrollo de servicios y productos innovadores en el mercado de la piscina residencial y comercial a escala global y tenemos una misión muy clara: crear la experiencia perfecta de piscina y wellness de forma responsable.

Actualmente operamos en más de 47 países a través de filiales propias. Contamos con más de 135 delegaciones comerciales y más de 35 centros de producción alrededor del mundo, además de plataformas logísticas distribuidas estratégicamente para dar soporte tanto a los centros de producción como a los de distribución.

Nos encantaría contar contigo en nuestro equipo humano, actualmente formado por más de 7.000 personas, grandes profesionales especialistas en diferentes disciplinas.

Como Pricing Analyst tendrás la misión de desarrollar y ejecutar estrategias de precios para maximizar la rentabilidad y competitividad de los productos o servicios de la empresa. Este rol implica un análisis profundo de datos de mercado, ventas, transaccional, tendencias de precios y comportamiento de la demanda.

En tu día a día, serás responsable de: 

 Analizar datos de precios para identificar tendencias y áreas de mejora.
Desarrollar e implementar estrategias de precios para productos.
Crear modelos de precios para prever ingresos y rentabilidad.
Colaborar con los equipos de ventas, marketing y finanzas para asegurar que las estrategias de precios se alineen con los objetivos generales del negocio.
 Evaluar la competencia y las tendencias del mercado para ajustar las estrategias de precios.
Realizar un seguimiento del rendimiento de los precios y proponer ajustes según sea necesario.
 Fijación de precios: Establecer precios adecuados para los productos y servicios.
 Gross-to-Net Management: Gestionar la diferencia entre el precio bruto y el precio neto, asegurando la rentabilidad.
 Seguimiento y evolución del margen: Monitorear y analizar los márgenes de beneficio para identificar oportunidades de mejora.
 Gestión de Transfer Price: Administrar los precios de transferencia entre diferentes unidades de negocio o filiales.
¿Qué esperamos de ti?

Que cuentes con formación en Administración de Empresas, Economía, Finanzas o un campo relacionado
Que hayas desempeñado un rol similar durante al menos 3 años. 
Que demuestres habilidades analíticas y capacidad para trabajar con grandes volúmenes de datos. 
Que aportes conocimiento de herramientas de análisis de datos y software de modelado financiero. 
Que seas una persona con excelentes habilidades de comunicación y capacidad para trabajar en equipo. 
Que puedas comunicarte en español e inglés de forma fluida. 

Además, Valoraremos Muy Positivamente

Que tengas capacidad de tomar decisiones basadas en datos.
Que estés familiarizado/a con la elasticidad de la demanda y otros conceptos económicos relevantes. 
Que cuentes con experiencia previa en entornos B2B.

¿Qué puedes esperar tú de Fluidra?

 Un equipo de profesionales que trabaja de forma colaborativa buscando la innovación y mejora continua con honestidad y pasión 💪
 Un proyecto estable, con contratación indefinida y retribución flexible: tú decides si quieres destinar parte de tu retribución bruta a productos exentos de IRPF (tarjeta restaurante, transporte, guardería y seguro médico) 🚑👪🚈 🍴
 Flexibilidad horaria, con jornada intensiva los viernes y todo el mes de agosto 😄
 Modelo organizativo híbrido: podrás combinar la presencia en nuestras oficinas con el trabajo desde casa dos días a la semana 🏡
Oficinas ubicadas en Sant Cugat del Vallés, fácilmente accesibles en ferrocarril (Sant Joan). 🚇 
 Descuentos especiales en diferentes productos y servicios 🎁
Un plan de carrera a medida, con formaciones focalizadas en tus áreas de mejora y cursos online de diferentes temáticas. ¡Tú eliges en qué, cuándo y cómo formarte! 🎓

En Fluidra apostamos por el desarrollo profesional y personal de las personas. Gracias a nuestro equipo de profesionales altamente cualificados podemos cumplir con nuestra principal misión: Crear la experiencia perfecta de Piscina y Wellness de forma responsable.
¿Quieres conocernos?
servicios y productos innovadores
47 países
7.000 personas
Pricing Analyst
desarrollar y ejecutar estrategias de precios
serás responsable de
Analizar datos de precios para identificar tendencias y áreas de mejora.
Desarrollar e implementar estrategias de precios para productos.
Crear modelos de precios para prever ingresos y rentabilidad.
Colaborar con los equipos de ventas, marketing y finanzas para asegurar que las estrategias de precios se alineen con los objetivos generales del negocio.
 Evaluar la competencia y las tendencias del mercado para ajustar las estrategias de precios.
Realizar un seguimiento del rendimiento de los precios y proponer ajustes según sea necesario.
 Fijación de precios: Establecer precios adecuados para los productos y servicios.
 Gross-to-Net Management: Gestionar la diferencia entre el precio bruto y el precio neto, asegurando la rentabilidad.
 Seguimiento y evolución del margen: Monitorear y analizar los márgenes de beneficio para identificar oportunidades de mejora.
 Gestión de Transfer Price: Administrar los precios de transferencia entre diferentes unidades de negocio o filiales.

4130468776.title: Financial Analyst
4130468776.description:
About the job
🌍Do you want to revolutionise how we buy clothes in a more accessible, personalised and sustainable way? 

 🦸‍♂️🦸‍♀️ Do you want to develop your talent in a TOP Startup and collaborate with the best professionals?

💻 Would you like to work remotely, and organize your schedule according to your needs?

Our purpose

From Lookiero we are driving the change of online personalised shopping, making it more accessible to everyone. Our mission is to empower thousands of customers, inspire them and help them discover their full potential to succeed in their daily lives.

Since our launch in 2016, we have grown rapidly to become Europe's leading online personal shopping platform with a presence in 12 European countries and more than 600 employees and collaborators of 27 nationalities.

What will be your challenge? (Key accountabilities)

You will need to understand historical financial data and key performance indicators (KPIs) and be able to extract information from the analysis. 
You will carry out different financial analysis across group operations in order to obtain conclusions on performance and provide solutions for internal improvement. 
You will contribute to the updating and preparation of key monthly reports, such as monthly group management accounts, results by market and other financial/functional KPIs.
You will attend to current and new investor requests and documentation (quarterly board meetings, …).
You will actively participate in the preparation of the financial plan. 
You will monitor and optimise business KPIs and analyse deviations.
You will obtain a relevant level of knowledge across all business areas by understanding processes, challenges and opportunities.
You will challenge current controlling processes in order to provide solutions to improve it since day 1 with the goal of having an agile and efficient function.


What will make you succeed? (Skills, know-how and experience)

You have at least 3 years of experience in Controlling or Financial Planning departments. Previous experience in a start-up environment; preferably a B2C online company is a plus.
You must have solid knowledge of financial analysis and accounting and knowledge of data processing tools (SQL, Power BI…)
You speak and write English fluently.
You have a strong domain of the office package.


In addition, we would especially like to see…👀

You have a strong analytical and data-driven mindset with problem solving focus. 
You are a quick learner and can handle the ownership of various tasks and projects in parallel.
 You have good communication skills, a positive attitude, and are able to communicate with several departments on a daily basis.
You are a team-player but know also how to work independently.
 You are solutions-oriented and take project objectives and deadlines seriously.
You are enthusiastic, proactive, and passionate about the start-up universe and the fashion world
 And the most important: eager to learn.


What will we bring to you?

⌛ Remote work and flexible working hours. If working from Bilbao is too far away for you, that's OK! We support remote working and flexible hours so that you can have the balance you want with your personal life.

📚 English classes and training budget: We believe in training as a tool to evolve as a professional, to get the best out of you and to be always up to date!

💰Flexible remuneration. Benefit platform through which you will obtain interesting tax advantages and interesting discounts.

🛍️ Lookiero Discounts. And of course, you will enjoy discounts on your purchases at Lookiero, valids for friends and family.

🤩 Professional growth. Personal development plan to evolve within Lookiero.

💼 Your impact will be tangible - and we empower people in the “how”. Working in a startup, you will see the impact of your voice, ideas and work very clearly on our business. You will be encouraged (and required) to share your opinions (of course, in a well-argumented way!). We also believe in giving freedom on how to get to pre-agreed OKRs.

👫 We are one team. With a culture of true collaboration and support, you will find that everyone is always up to help you solve your challenges and have a friendly chat. Good vibes reign!

How do we like to do things?

We think big and act fast.

We own our decisions and drive results.

We say things the way they are.

We are a team.

Anything is possible for us.

What will the selection process be like?

1- Initial interview with the Talent Team.

2- Technical assessment/ case study.

3- Technical interview with the Hiring Manager.

4- Interview with stakeholders.

5- Last but not least, the final stage is the Offer.

#LookieroHighlights

🥇 Ranked on LinkedIn Top Startups 2022.

👧 4 million registered female users in 10 countries.

🤝 +600 employees and collaborators

🏢 3 offices: Bilbao (HQ), París and Berlín.

⛰️🥾 We are committed to Remote Culture and work-life balance.

If you want to be a key player in our team, see the impact of your work and are excited to learn more about us and the position, APPLY.

Disclaimer:The data controller of your personal data is Lookiero Style, S.L. with tax identification number B-95810826. Your personal data will be collected and processed according to all applicable regulations and specifically to GDPR 2016/679. Your personal data will be collected for the purpose of evaluating your application for the selection process and will be kept for the terms established by law. We remind you that you can exercise your rights of access, rectification, deletion, limitation of processing and portability by writing to dpo@lookiero.com. We also inform you that your data will not be subject to automated individual decisions or transfers to countries outside the EEA. For more information you can consult our privacy policy.

4161654126.title: Business/System Analyst - Financial Technology Solutions and Payments
4161654126.description:
About the job
Euronet seeks to employ a skilled Business/System Analyst with a passion for creating innovative financial solutions and payment systems to join our team at our offices in Madrid!
The successful candidate will contribute to impactful worldwide projects utilizing cutting-edge technologies in the field of electronic financial transactions while working in collaboration with diverse teams in a dynamic multinational environment.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Gather, analyze, and document business and functional requirements for IT systems.
Design and propose new solutions for Euronet's clients, including improvements to existing systems.
Work closely with technical teams, such as Developers and Quality Assurance Engineers to ensure technical feasibility and high-quality outcomes.
Provide clear and concise technical specification documents as well as regular report to management.
Identify risks or issues impacting business outcomes and propose effective solutions or necessary adjustments.

Requirements
GENERAL REQUIREMENTS:
University degree in Computer Science/Engineering or Information Technology. A post-graduate degree will be considered a plus.
3 - 5 years of experience in System Analysis and Design (experience within financial technology, services, or banking is a plus).
Understanding of databases and data models.
Native in Spanish and fluency in English, both written and verbal.
Eligible to work in the EU on full-time permanent basis without the need of employer sponsorship.

COMPETENCIES:
Methodical approach, analytical thinking, and attention to detail.
Clear presentation and outstanding communication skills.
Ability to work effectively within diverse, multinational teams.
Proactive problem-solving and creative thinking capabilities.
Process-oriented mindset with a focus on precise documentation and reporting.

Benefits
Work in a dynamic, stable, international environment.
Excellent career prospects within a dynamic and multinational organization with leading position in the market and ambitious expansion plans.

4119100636.title: KYC Analyst
4119100636.description:
About the job
About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone’s life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

🚀 Join us as a KYC Analyst and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a KYC Analyst, you will be at the forefront of ensuring seamless onboarding experiences for our valued customers. Collaborating closely with FinCrime, Compliance and Operations, we ensure a comprehensive approach to risk mitigation and regulatory adherence without forgetting to ensure a great UX for our customers. You will be part of the KYC Team and report to the KYC Team Lead.

Your Mission

Perform due diligence. Ensure appropriate client documentation is captured and provide timely onboarding for new customers.
Analyze and assess profiles. Verify identities, identify potential red flags, and escalate particular cases to the FinCrime team.
Assist customers. Provide assistance primarily via email during the verification and activation process to ensure a smooth and efficient experience.
Utilize screening databases. Screen customers using PEP (Politically Exposed Persons) databases and adverse media sources to identify potential risks.
Perform risk assessments. Conduct detailed customer risk assessments to identify and evaluate potential risks associated with clients.

Your Ideal Profile

Relevant experience. You have at least 1 year of experience in a similar role, ideally in a startup or the financial sector; customer care experience is also valued.
Legal framework knowledge. You have a clear understanding of AML/KYC legal frameworks, with AML/AFC qualification from ACAMS, ICA, or similar industry body considered a plus.
Language proficiency. You have professional proficiency in both written and verbal English; proficiency in Italian is considered a strong plus.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your perks as a Satisperson

🙆🏻 Join an international team to grow with

🏡 Hybrid working policy

🍽️ Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

🌐 Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

❤️‍🩹 Take care of yourself and your family with our health insurance plan

🚀 Own part of Satispay’s success with our Stock Option Plan

👩🏻‍💻 Gear up with our tech equipment

🥳 Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless – for instance – of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious about our core values? Explore them here.

4170840170.title: Financial Analyst

4096793895.title: Commercial Analyst Junior
4096793895.description:
About the job
Para nuestro departamento de Finanzas reportando a nuestra Business Planning Manager buscamos a un/a Commercial Analyst Junior

La misión del puesto será planificar la construcción del presupuesto anual y supervisar el desempeño del área comercial de Lyreco respecto a los objetivos financieros acordados para detectar riesgos y oportunidades ayudando a lograr los objetivos de negocio.

Funciones principales:

Tener el conocimiento adecuado tanto del mercado, como de la Compañía y de su cultura, que permita proponer y ejecutar acciones de mejora en la gestión del día a día apoyando al negocio.
Conocer y entender los diferentes modelos de negocio según categoría de ventas, así como su impacto en la información económica-financiera, con el objetivo de analizar la cuenta de resultados de las mismas.
Implementar la cuenta de resultados de Nuevo Negocio asegurando la veracidad de las hipótesis, circuito de validación y seguimiento post mortem con marketing.
Analizar los resultados de Lyreco Iberia comparado con los objetivos acordados para identificar posibles desviaciones y entender el impacto de las decisiones focalizando en las ventas y el margen comercial, proponiendo medidas correctoras a futuro.
 Ejecutar el proceso presupuestario anual de las áreas asignadas y colaborar en la coordinación y consolidación de todos los entregables de los departamentos involucrados, según requerimientos de Grupo.
 Coordinación del forecast mensual ventas y margen comercial con los diferentes heads y Regionales, identificando y comunicando los riesgos y oportunidades al Business Planning Manager y a la Dirección Financiera.
 Analizar las ventas y el margen comercial de la compañía desde la visión cliente y categoría de producto
Preparación de Business Case de nuevos procesos de negocio identificando riesgos y oportunidades, así como necesidad de cambios en los procesos habituales de compañía que se deberán contemplar en el Business Case y hacer seguimiento y análisis post mortem de estos una vez implementados.
 Ejecutar los procesos necesarios para realizar un control de gestión en las áreas de la cuenta de resultados gestionados por Finanzas según las instrucciones del Business Planning Manager.
Ejecutar la revisión mensual de OPEX de los departamentos asignados y análisis por naturaleza de gasto identificando los riesgos y oportunidades.
Realizar análisis ad-hoc según requerimiento del Business Planning Manager.
Obtener un conocimiento adecuado del área operativa para poder ser backup del Corporate Services Business Analyst.
Crear informes y reportes personalizados y estandarizados, basados en la información de los sistemas de la compañía Clickview (BING), IBM Planning Analytics (LPA) para el análisis de datos cuantitativos y de los diversos KPIs para ayudar a la toma de decisiones.
Asegurar la transparencia y fiabilidad de los datos operativos y financieros, y que el negocio cumple los controles operativos y financieros marcados en las políticas y procedimientos de Grupo.


Requisitos

Grado en Empresariales/ADE/Economía
Conocimientos de contabilidad y auditoría.
Idiomas: Necesario nivel medio de inglés equivalente a un First Certificate.
Nivel avanzado de Excel/Word/PWP/Outlook y SAP.
Se valorará experiencia en el uso de Power BI.
Experiencia mínima de 2 años en departamento financiero o comercial desarrollando funciones de análisis financiero o bien 2 años de Auditoria interna/externa.

4173690486.title: Senior Credit Analyst
4173690486.description:
About the job
Job title – Credit Analyst (74084)

Location – Barcelona, Spain

Job model – Hybrid

We are seeking a dedicated professional with a passion for credit risk analysis. The role involves conducting comprehensive credit assessment, including the collection, examination, and interpretation of various data related to the existing and potential customers. The ideal candidate will be skilled in preparing and presenting credit recommendations to the decision-makers. Additionally, this role requires ongoing monitoring of accounts to identify, analyze and mitigate potential credit risks.

At dsm-firmenich, being a force for good is not optional. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is a shared responsibility woven into our daily work to not only benefit our People, Customers & Communities but also drive business value. Equal access to opportunities is a given, belonging is a shared feeling, authenticity is celebrated.

Your Key Responsibilities

 Evaluate potential and existing clients using our credit model, which incorporates financial statements and qualitative data, to provide precise credit recommendations and ensure adherence to the credit group policy by all relevant stakeholders.
 Facilitate sales growth in complex countries and mid-markets by proposing credit risk mitigation solutions (such as trade finance) and closely monitoring accounts receivable to minimize write-offs in these regions.
 Oversee and approve the release of blocked sales orders after thorough analysis and validation.
 Develop and maintain strong partnerships with both external and internal stakeholders, including Business, Controlling, Customer Experience, and Collection Teams.
 Gain a deep understanding of the business, including its nature, growth strategy, customer types, country-specific factors, products, seasonality, sales organization structure, and global credit organization.
 Update and maintain process documentation and support the implementation of process improvements.

We bring

 A rich history and a promising future of bold scientific innovation and passionate creation with our customers;
 A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;
 A culture that prioritizes safety and well-being, both physically and mentally;
 The opportunity to work for a company where sustainability is much more than a claim and is core to our strategy and purpose;
 A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome;
 Barrier-free communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected – regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity;
 A firm belief that working together with our customers is the key to achieving great things;
 An eagerness to be one team and learn from each other to bring progress to life and create a better future;

You bring 

 University Degree or equivalent.
 Minimum of 3- 5 years of prior experience in credit management, accounting, or finance.
 Very good knowledge basis in financial ratios in order to provide accurate credit reports and recommendations.
 Maintain a positive attitude, flexible, good team player with ability to work independently and to multi-task.
 Proficiency in MS Office pack including Microsoft Excel tools and SAP knowledge.
 Fluent communication skills in English – both oral and written.
 Conversation level of Spanish

The application process

Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by uploading your resume in English via our career portal.

Equal Opportunities Commitment

dsm-firmenich is fully dedicated to inclusion because when people feel engaged and empowered, their creativity and innovation drives unprecedented progress. We aim to build a workplace where opportunity really is equal, so everyone can thrive. We do not discriminate: there’s a place for everyone at dsm-firmenich.

As a committed equal opportunity employer, we ensure our recruitment practices are inclusive and fair. We encourage the recruitment of a diverse workforce, representative of the communities in which we work, by using inclusive language, diverse interview panels, diversified sourcing strategies. Selection is based on qualifications, competency, experience, performance history and fit with the team to advance fair and equitable opportunity.

Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, backgrounds, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

We are committed to providing reasonable support for disabled applicants in our recruiting process. Should you need assistance, and are comfortable to share this, please let us know.

About Dsm-firmenich

As innovators in nutrition, health, and beauty, dsm-firmenich reinvents, manufactures, and combines vital nutrients, flavors, and fragrances for the world’s growing population to thrive. With our comprehensive range of solutions, with natural and renewable ingredients and renowned science and technology capabilities, we work to create what is essential for life, desirable for consumers, and more sustainable for the planet. dsm-firmenich is a Swiss-Dutch company, listed on the Euronext Amsterdam, with operations in almost 60 countries and revenues of more than €12 billion. With a diverse, worldwide team of nearly 30,000 employees, we bring progress to life™ every day, everywhere, for billions of people. www.dsm-firmenich.com

Pease note this is a direct search led by dsm-firmenich. We only accept applications from candidates, not from agencies nor subject to agency’s fees, percentages or similar.

4166878266.title: Finance Analyst
4166878266.description:
About the job
Company: REVER

Location: Barcelona, Spain

Type: Full-Time

Start Date: March

About REVER

We’re redefining returns and refunds. REVER was born to change how the world buys, ensuring returns are as effortless as purchases. Backed by YCombinator, leading VCs, and founders from unicorn companies across Europe, we are in an exciting phase of rapid growth and product-market fit. With ambitious goals to expand globally, we are looking for passionate individuals to help us revolutionize the customer experience.

Role Overview

We are looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented Finance Analyst to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone with experience in finance / audit, venture capital (VC), private equity (PE), and corporate finance, with a keen interest in start-ups. The Finance Analyst will support REVER’s founders in investor discussions, prepare financial reports, and assist in fundraising efforts. Additionally, this role will involve financial administration and support for REVER’s clients, working closely with the product and operations teams.

You Will

Support the founders in investor conversations by preparing financial models, reports, and key metrics.
Assist in fundraising efforts, including preparing investment materials and conducting financial analysis.
Develop and maintain financial reporting for internal and external stakeholders.
Work closely with the product and operations teams to provide financial support to clients.
Ensure accurate and timely financial data collection, analysis, and reporting.
Assist in budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning to support business growth.
Provide insights on financial performance and suggest improvements based on data analysis.

You Have

2-4 years of experience in finance, venture capital, private equity, investment banking, or corporate finance.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in financial modeling, Excel, and data analysis tools.
Experience in preparing financial reports and investment materials.
Ability to work with large datasets and extract meaningful insights.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to interact with investors and stakeholders.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently.
Interest in start-ups, fundraising, and corporate finance.

Why Should You Join Us?

Be part of a fast-growing company backed by top-tier investors.
Work closely with REVER’s leadership team on high-impact financial initiatives.
Gain hands-on experience in investor relations and fundraising.
Work in a dynamic, international environment based in the heart of Barcelona.
Enjoy a competitive salary, benefits, and professional growth opportunities.
Help revolutionize the e-commerce and reverse logistics space by making returns as seamless as purchases.

4147651266.title: Financial Analyst
4147651266.description:
About the job
Hi! 👋🏼
At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Financial Analyst to take our Finance team to the next level 🚀

1. Team and Role
If you have experience in Accounting and/or FP&A, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.
This role offers the opportunity to have a “360” experience of a Finance department within a fast-growing Startup. 
We, in Finance, are a small team with strong commitment and connections with the rest of the teams, so you will have the chance to learn and grow very fast, there are a lot of things to do!
If you’re excited by working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! 

2. What you´ll be doing

In your day-to-day as a Financial analyst you will work hand-to-hand and report to the Head of Finance to contribute to the main areas of the Finance team, mainly be:

Monthly closing procedure, you will work hand to hand with our accounting and tax advisory as well as with the billing team to close the books. This will include: 
Tax, you will be the main owner and contributor of our taxes compliance, this includes VAT (SII) and Retention, working closely with our tax advisory.
Contributor for the Annual Statutory Audit as well as Grants obtention or Due Diligence.
Contribute to any finance project that will arise because of Shakers International expansion starting 2025.
Accounts receivable and payable management with our customers and suppliers.
Resolve billing discrepancies as well as support with external customers platforms.Make sure that all the invoices are collected on time.
Review the bookings made by the accounting advisory and make sure everything is accurate.
Work with the billing team to make sure that all the transactional bookings are done correctly and ontime.
Do the analytical chart of accounts mapping as well as comparing Actuals vs Forecast.

3. What we´re looking for 
You´re a great fit if you...
Have 1-2 years of work experience in Audit firms, especially in Big 4, and/or 1-2 years of experience in a marketplace or SaaS startup.
Have a degree in Finance or Accounting.
Are knowledgeable and interested in the startup ecosystem.Have great communication skills to build relationships with the rest of the teams of the company and third parties.
Are familiar with KPIs, dashboards, and analytics. Have a data-driven profile.
Are proactive &; take ownership of your projects and responsibilities.
Have a high level of English both spoken and written.

4. What's in it for you?
Compensation 💰The salary range for this position is between 26.000€ and 32.000€
The salary consists of:
Between 26.000€ & 28.000€ fixed salary
Up to 4.000€ yearly divided into quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you´ll love working at Shakers 💚
Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. 🌍
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture—ask anyone on our team!Take advantage of our fully flexible methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Velázquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance and more.
At the office... 📍
Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine


5. Our recruitment process
As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process. Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one! 
The Road to Joining Our Team:
Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don’t worry—we just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Finance Team: Join two members of our Finance Team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your recruiting skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet Héctor, our CEO! He’s excited to connect with you over a coffee, talk about Shakers’ future, and discuss your vision and expectations.

More about Shakers
At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working. Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology. We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA
At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!
WINNING TEAM 🏆We all feel like part of a winning team—one that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.
F1C10 💪🏼We’re building an environment where fear doesn’t hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren’t afraid to go big!
STAY HUMBLE 🤲🏼We embrace a beginner’s mindset—always evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary! 

A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see

you soon.

Work with the billing team to make sure that all the transactional bookings are done correctly and ontime.

The Road to Joining
Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don’t worry—we just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Finance Team: Join two members of our Finance Team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your recruiting skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.

4140397213.title: Senior Financial Analyst, EU Regional Insights
4140397213.description:
About the job
Description

Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and, when the box arrived, you wondered how it got to you so fast? Have you wondered where it came from and how much it cost Amazon to deliver it to you?

Amazon Logistics (AMZL) is Amazon's "Last Mile" delivery service, responsible for delivering packages to customers across the world. The AMZL network is undergoing quick growth and change on a global scale. Our teams are changing the way we interact with customers every single day and solving some of the biggest logistical issues facing not just Amazon, but the entire industry. AMZL is developing an innovative world-class Last Mile operation with a portfolio of buildings, vehicles, and technology to deliver customers' packages on time and tailored to our ever-changing customer expectations. AMZL Finance teams partner closely with global cross-functional business and tech teams to support this rapidly expanding business; promoting controllership, innovation, productivity, and cost-effective operations across the network in a fast paced environment.

Overview

We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst that is excited to join a tech company that is constantly improving and re-imagining the logistics industry. Our candidate should be passionate about using data to solve big, complex and ambiguous problems. The candidate should be eager to continuously learn and improve their skills. You should be attentive to which details make all the difference. Do you want to contribute shaping the new standard of shopping? If so, come and join the EU AMZL Finance Team.

As part of the AMZL Finance team, you will join a team that is motivated about numbers, data, and how to use them to generate insights and improve our business. We support and influence the AMZL organization by providing a holistic and financial perspective, we are the trusted business advisors. We collaborate with our partners to ensure leaders to have the most up to date and reliable information, and work with them to make sure AMZL is making the best possible decisions.

Key job responsibilities

 Leverage Amazon Logistic metrics to identify cost out opportunities by linking up operations and financials. Understands the details of the cost structure to make thoughtful judgement calls in ambiguous environments where data may be difficult to procure.
 Build trusted partnership with the business to influence and support tactical and strategic business decisions promoting business improvements and cost reductions. Communicates data (both written and verbal) in a clear, concise, and unambiguous manner. Your communications drive critical business actions.
 Identifies risks, evaluates impact, proposes changes, and implements improvements to remediate gaps. Identify opportunities and lead projects to streamline processes and reports
 Supervise and own the Financial and operational planning processes to produce a challenging/stretch/bold yet solid operational plan. Supervise and own all Month-end procedures including accruals and variance analysis between scenarios (actuals, Plan, Forecast...)
 Hire, develop and mentor peers and team members, while promoting knowledge-sharing

LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES

 Autonomy to innovate and deliver new approaches
 Grow and collaborate in a fast-pace environment where every day is day one
 Learn from people and cooperate with a wide variety of professional backgrounds
 Ability to develop new skills and opportunities through lateral, geographical or functional moves

Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in engineering, statistics or business, or a Bachelor's degree and experience in quantitative role (engineering, process re-engineering, quality assurance)
 Experience applying key financial performance indicators (KPIs) to analyses
 Experience in creating process improvements with automation and analysis
 Experience in identifying, leading, and executing opportunities to improve, automate, standardize or simplify finance or business tools and processes
 Experience with advanced use of SQL for data mining and business intelligence

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience participating in continuous improvement projects in your team to scale and improve controllership with measurable results
 Experience working with large-scale data mining and reporting tools (examples: SQL, MS Access, Essbase, Cognos) and other financial systems (examples: Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Amazon EU SARL (Spain Branch)

4083361340.title: Senior Financial Analyst
4083361340.description:
About the job
This role sits in the Financial Accounting team, within the Finance Department, focused on the Statutory reporting of the Group (internal and external).

Purpose of the role: 
To work with the financial accounting team to ensure the accurate and timely production of financial results for internal and external reporting, and robust reporting and review of the Group balance sheet and other financial KPIs
To interrogate and analyse the P&L and balance sheet, to obtain a thorough understanding of underlying balances and the associated processes and controls behind them
To support with specific ad hoc analysis and project work, with a focus on identifying the risks, opportunities and controls

Responsibilities: 
Support the preparation of components of the Group Financial statements on a quarterly basis as part of the Financial Accounting team, ensuring prepared on a timely basis, accurately and compliant with relevant accounting standards. To include the preparation of relevant information for shareholders, investors and analysts and alignment between management and statutory information where necessary.
Support the preparation of detailed analysis for auditors to ensure all necessary information is provided to audit year end financial statements (and interim if applicable) with no requirement for late adjustments. Have a thorough understanding of balance sheet items, ensuring that they are valid, supported, and that the associated controls and processes are adequate
Support in the ongoing maintenance and review of the balance sheet by preparing and reviewing reconciliations, identifying discrepancies early and rectifying them, and by challenging recognition where necessary, To perform BS reconciliations, principally of accruals and provisions, identifying sensitivities, risks and opportunities and ensuring they are properly supported.
Help in the minimum controls framework reporting as well as follow up of the control deficiencies identified. 

Skills: 
Adaptable and flexible for rapidly changing needs of the organisational reporting as necessary
Advanced excel
Very good understanding of HFM and SAP
Willing and able to take a proactive approach
Strong communication skills
Ability to work under pressure effectively
Ability work well within a team
An inquisitive and proactive approach and growth mindset
Hands on mindset
Good attention to detail
Highly organized

Experience: 
5 years previous demonstrable experience of working within a team effectively, in the Finance team of a multinational company or in audit.
Good standard of education
Fluent in Spanish and English
Understanding of IFRS requirements
Desirable experience in financial controls.
Desirable Experience in a listed company, either within an organisation or as an auditor

Qualifications: 
Required: Relevant Finance or business degree
Desirable: Part qualified or fully qualified accountant

4149148325.title: Senior FP&A Analyst
4149148325.description:
About the job
Role Purpose

We are seeking an experienced Senior FP&A Analyst to join our finance team. The ideal candidate will play a critical role in financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and strategic decision-making. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven insights, optimize financial performance, and support executive leadership with strategic recommendations.

Primary Responsibilities

Lead budgeting and forecasting processes, ensuring accuracy and alignment with business objectives.
Develop financial models to support strategic decision-making, scenario planning, and long-term growth initiatives.
Provide rolling forecasts and variance analysis to track performance against budget and prior periods.
Analyze financial results, identify key drivers, and provide actionable insights to senior management.
Develop KPI dashboards and reports to monitor business performance and drive operational efficiency.
Partner with various departments to analyze costs, revenue trends, and profitability.
Preparing business cases to support new investment, strategic and other business decisions
Reviewing existing processes and procedures to develop recommendations for improvement efforts

Knowledge & Skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills both in English and spanish
Strong financial modelling skills
High level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Ability to work independently and as a team member with excellent interpersonal skills.
Strong project management and planning skills to successfully manage multiple, simultaneous projects.
Critical thinking, problem solving and decision making.
Willingness to learn, change status quo, and not take No for an answer.
Knowledge of the SQL language is an advantage.
Able to work effectively as a business partner with various stakeholders.

Benefits

💪 Private health and dental insurance.
👟 Discounted gym membership.
💻 Freedom to work from home two days a week.
🍎 Kitchen with free coffee and fruit each Monday, Wednesday and Friday and snacks.
🌍 Team building activities and work in an international and passionate environment.

Don't miss the opportunity to be part of a company that values innovation and talent! Join us and take your career to the next level 🚀

4168486934.title: CFO Analyst
4168486934.description:
About the job
Sobre la empresa
Firma especializada en consultoría estratégica y financiera, enfocada en impulsar el crecimiento de startups tecnológicas y pymes. Con un equipo altamente cualificado, busca talento con visión estratégica, orientación a resultados y capacidad analítica.
Descripción del puesto
Buscamos un CFO Analyst con experiencia en consultoría financiera para asesorar a startups y pymes en su estrategia de crecimiento. Este rol combina funciones de controlling, planificación financiera y fundraising, ayudando a los clientes a optimizar su estructura financiera y asegurar la sostenibilidad de su negocio.
 Requisitos
Formación en ADE, Economía, Ingeniería o similar. Valorable máster en Finanzas.
Experiencia en consultoría financiera o departamentos de estrategia financiera.
Fuertes habilidades analíticas, organizativas y de planificación.
Capacidad de comunicación y trabajo en equipo.
Mentalidad estratégica y orientación a resultados.
Proactividad, innovación y habilidades de negociación.
Beneficios
Retribución competitiva y plan de carrera definido.
Formación continua y aprendizaje en un entorno dinámico.
Participación en la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Oportunidad de crecimiento en una empresa en plena expansión.
